item.title: Write High-quality code
item.description: !NOTE! This Blog is under continuing updating. Some Experience to Share For Writing Good Code During my experience of researching and doing projects, I believe it is always very helpful to manage good code.

item.title: Prepare and Pass the Qualifying Exams.
item.description: Taking the qualifying exam is the first milestone for most of the PhD students. I’ve just passed my qualifying exam on June 12th, 2024 in the ECE department at University of Toronto.

item.title: Prepare your application for CS PhD.
item.description: Catalog Catalog Before You Read Let’s Start Introduction Before Application What do I mean by managing research? Why do you need papers? The Application Connection Reference Letter Research Experience Publications Choosing programs and professors CV Meeting Slides Personal History Statement SOP/PS/RP Writing a PS Paragraph 1 Paragraph 2-4 Last two paragraphs GPA Research Internship TOFEL/GRE Connecting Professors via Email After Application Contact Me Previous students advised Before You Read This will be a long article which will take you approximately about 15 minutes to read.
I believe having a good code repo is a necessary part of a good paper. You can find the source code for my papers and other interesting projects through my Github.

item.title: Photo Gallery
item.description: 💏 With my beloved beautiful girl, Ziqi Li. ⭐ With Professor Baochun Li, Professor Vincent Wong, and members of iQua on 2024 Engineering Institute of Canada (EIC) Gala. 📷 by Mitch Lenet

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can learn more about my papers through Google Scholar. Privacy-preserving Machine Learning Hengyuan Xu, Liyao Xiang, Hangyu Ye, Dixi Yao, Pengzhi Chu, Baochun Li. “Permutation Equivariance of Transformers and Its Applications” in Proceedings of The IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition 2024 (CVPR), Seattle, USA, Jun 17 - Jun 21, 2024.
